website_summaries.verdict: The MSI R9 280X Gaming 3G is for gamers who want more muscle in their game play than what entry-level graphics cards can provide. It's the best choice for those looking to upgrade to a higher-end GPU.
pros: Multi-monitor options more flexible than previous in previous iterations
cons: The graphics architecture is getting a bit long in the tooth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent video card after BIOS update
customer_reviews.text: Amazing card that can handle easily the most demanding of today's games. You wont get 60FPS on Metro:Last light on the highest settings out of the box, but manages to handle Crysis 3 perfectly. What I didn't like about this card is that the BIOS made the card throttle during intense load. Had to ask for procedure and new BIOS to flash the card to make it work as advertised. For some people this is an easy procedure but I was not comfortable messing around with my brand new GPU BIOS and this is an issue that should have been resolved by MSI before thinking of selling the product.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Product DOA!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived DOA! Tried to contact the manufacturer and they said S# was listed as: "Product Returned for Exchange". The Product was listed as factory refurbished on Amazon. The manufacturer said the product was taken out of circulation and was used for recycle and should have never been released for resale, refurbished or not. I have no recourse at this point except not to ever buy refurbished items again. My mistake and my loss.
customer_reviews.author: Martin P. English

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: This card is whisper quiet honestly. It came in practically brand new from Tegra Tech Store, with a warranty and no issues. The card runs every game I need it to run and the 3GB of VRAM definitely helps with some games that are VRAM whores. I don't think I've ever had a problem with heat, noise or performance. The card never goes over 75 degrees Celsius for me, which is just perfect. Idle, it stays at about 33 degrees Celsius. This is a must buy if it fits your budget.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: great for my gaming i can play civilization V on high graphics settings and still get smooth gaming. one thing i will note is that i did start having dead squares on my screen that would flicker mostly when i would game after a while maybe it was only my unit but i cannot complain because even with this i would get 60 fps on call of duty BO2 with no lag at all. I've even played total war rome 2 on high settings and this baby handled it like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin p.

customer_reviews.title: Flicker madness
customer_reviews.text: Flickers like mad in 2D. Had two units and both were defective (one more so than the other). Adding a bit of a boost to core voltage (+20mV) seemed to stabilize this but I returned both cards because you shouldn't have to do this. Also read later that it's a general R9 issue where the GPU goes into a low power state and loses stability. MSI wanted to RMA one of them to see what was up and send me a refurbished unit. For this price, no. Love you, Amazon, and your return policy. On plus side, card is very very quiet and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Powerhouse in a quiet package
customer_reviews.text: Want to play the latest games at 1920x1080 Ultra settings? Or even run it out to 2560x1440? This is your card. You want all that performance with a super quiet cooler? Yup. That's this card. I switched from a 6850 XFX Black edition to this card and the noise level was around halved. Running WatchDogs at 2560x1440 Ultra and it's totally playable. Basically anything older than that will run like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Zaphod

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, artifacts right away
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, artifacts right away. Amazon said it will not accept a return because I used a courrier to receive it in my country, will avoid ordering electronics from Amazon for a while. Check all the negative reviews around online, this MSI card is defective, it's not a 1-time thing. It will be very hard for me to buy anything with the MSI name on it again.

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent video card
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent video card. I upgraded from a Geforce GTX 570 and there is a huge performance increase. Make sure your power supply can handle it. It has both an 8 pin and a 6 pin connector. The AMD drivers run like a charm. Not like the ATI drivers of old. I got a like new card for $180 instead of the usual $300. It is spectacularly good value.
customer_reviews.author: Marisol

customer_reviews.title: even small things like the plastic caps for ports were in place
customer_reviews.text: Bought a refurbished card for a fraction of the price. Has been extremely solid with no issues. All factory packaging was included, even small things like the plastic caps for ports were in place. Would definitely consider this option again in the future. As for the card itself, there are ample places to research benchmarks for your needs. As for mine, it can handle every game I've thrown at it on Ultra. Considering how cheap the refurbished card was, I could add a second to my rig and be worry free for years.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great once Amazon actually gets you the product
customer_reviews.text: The item works great...just don't buy Amazon warehouse deals. It took THREE attempts to get the item. The first order, they "mistakenly" sent a R9 270 (no, they just wanted to pass it off as a 280X), the second time they sent a defective unit. The third time, they finally sent a working, correct item. Now that the item is here, it works great. It can handle some pretty hardcore graphics I've thrown at it in fact on Ultra settings. So, that's good.

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for GPU mining
customer_reviews.text: I run a pair of these and a pair of Sapphire Dual-X 280X cards. Both brands are capable of the same 730kh/s hashrate at stock settings. Except, I'm able to undervolt the MSIs down to 1v (possible less, haven't tried), where Sapphires can only manage 1.125v. Also, MSI provides larger fans. So, coupled with better undervolting the cards have been maintaining their temps better.

customer_reviews.title: Coil noise
customer_reviews.text: My card suffers from a KNOWN issue know as inductor 'whirring'. It's a noise that is made by the coil elements of the cards during heavy use. I still gave it 3 stars as it doesn't (SO FAR) cause any performance issues, however a NON-mechanical component making such a noise doesn't strike me as a good thing. Also MSI's warranty doesn't cover the replacement of the device for this issue. So I have to live with this disconcerting noise, not knowing if it will ultimately lead to decreased life of the card or if it will just be an annoyance.
